column4: ok, i've got a question. a lot of people in here ask about 3D acceleration, whether with nvidia or ati. What are the benefits of it? Does it matter for somebody who only uses, say, ratpoison WM and isn't a gamer?
ok, that about answers my question. thanks a lot!
window managers normally take no advantage of 3d accel
for example on my machines i have no 3d accel at all. i simply don't need it.
that makes sense. yeah, i don't have it either, and was just kind of wondering if i was missing out. lol
the problem with screen-like window managers is that many older X apps still need the mouse
also many newer ones. luckily, i don't use them, except for conkeror and sometimes xpdf
so why do you use X anyway? you could use a framebuffer console with screen
it's easier to use than elinks/w3m.
i use X with XFCE. as a web browser i use dillo, mozilla and w3m, depending on the situation
though quick question:  does ubuntu's framebuffer work this time around? (i.e., could i, say, watch a movie without starting X (i boot to commandline)?)
